meta_description: Donkey Mill Art Center - art classes, workshops, artist exhibits, youth art education, artist studios and events on the Big Island, Hawaii.
hours_text:
Visit[Meira Leonard](http://web.archive.org/web/20251017163549/https://donkeymillartcenter.org/author/adminonelionheart-com/ "Posts by Meira Leonard")2025-03-13T17:02:18-10:00

# Visit the Mill

Stop by to view our exhibitions, attend one of our many classes and events, explore the gardens and retail shop.

Whether you’re a visitor, volunteer, friend of a friend, or a member, you’ll find a shared sense of place to connect through arts, culture and community.

We’re open Wednesday – Saturday from 10am to 6pm

78-6670 Mamalahoa Hwy  
Hōlualoa, Hawaiʻi 96725  
(808) 322-3362

[Get Directions](http://web.archive.org/web/20251017163549/https://goo.gl/maps/HMUtM8dykUnodbND7)

Holidays & Closures:

The Mill closes seasonally for maintenance, deep cleaning, staff rest, and program planning. During these times we are not open to the public, though we continue to check email and voicemail.

Current list of closures:

Thanksgiving: Thursday & Friday, November 28 & 29, 2024  
Winter Closure: Saturday, December 21, 2024 – Tuesday, January 7, 2025

## Explore  
Our Campus

### Historic Building

Our main, wooden building was constructed in 1954 by the Kona Coffee Cooperative. Kona’s coffee farmers worked the steep slopes of Hualālai with a strong sense of community resilience recognized to this day as a defining quality of the Kona Way of Life.

### Gardens

Our gardens include a dedicated area for wauke (mulberry) used in kapa making, a forested lot with native ʻōhiʻa lehua trees and even...

collections_text:
Home[Meira Leonard](http://web.archive.org/web/20260103003709/https://donkeymillartcenter.org/author/adminonelionheart-com/ "Posts by Meira Leonard")2025-12-10T07:58:05-10:00

Welcome to the Donkey Mill Art Center—a place of convergence where arts and culture are considered a necessity, not a luxury.

[Our Programs](/web/20260103003709/https://donkeymillartcenter.org/art-programs)

### **Annual Fund 2025**

At the Donkey Mill, we believe that **art is life—and life is art**. Every day, creativity weaves its way across campus, transforming each of us: keiki gain confidence and find their voices through art, music, and dance; adults and kūpuna reconnect with their roots and uncover new parts of themselves through artistic expression; workshops offer space to learn, reflect, and create; and exhibitions and cultural events unite us through shared stories and diverse voices, all strengthening the bonds that make us a community.

**Creativity isn’t separate from life—it _is_ life. **Be part of the Mill’s story.

[GIVE TODAY](http://web.archive.org/web/20260103003709/https://bit.ly/MillAnnualFund2025)
